alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Lower Koyukuk Valley; Middle Yukon Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; South Slopes of the Western Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 5:59AM AKST until January 16 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... Heavy snow expected with blizzard conditions and brief freezing rain possible. * WHAT...Heavy snow and blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. Visibility could be one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Alaska. * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could cause power outages.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
